text: We're at a shopping mall... I came here with Chibi-Bana to buy some stuff.
Chibi-Bana: "First, you gotta choose a rod... but honestly, the ones at the 100-yen shop are more than enough for beginners!"
Chibi-Bana: "You can get a decent one for around 1000 yen! It's carbon, foldable, and super light! Even a total weakling like you can handle it."
Fishing gear. For beginners, the act of buying it can feel like a real psychological paywall.
Not knowing what to buy makes you hesitate... and then you end up not buying anything or not even trying.
You: "Speaking of weaklings, Tachibana, don't you go fishing?"
Chibi: "My sister? No way! Actually, you shouldn't let her fish!"
Chibi: "She'd get pulled in by even a whiting! If a black sea bream bites, she's fish food! And she can't swim!"
So frail... not just weak, practically fragile.
Chibi-Bana: "They even sell reels at the 100-yen shop. Seriously, it's enough! 100-yen shops are amazing these days! They even have sinkers!"
Chibi-Bana: "Just buy all the sinkers for now! They even have sinker cases! We'll get hooks at the fishing store."
So reliable...
You: "But why not get something better right from the start? Why not go for a higher-grade rod?"
Chibi-Bana: "That's 'cause you never know if you'll get hooked or not! It'd be a waste to buy something expensive and not enjoy it..."
A fishing rod is like a legendary sword. Necessary in times of war, but useless in peace.
Chibi: "A legendary sword is fine, at least you can cut carrots with it."
Chibi: "But fishing gear is totally useless if you don’t actually fish. At best you can use it to gouge out some annoying guy's eyeball."
You: "So if you stop fishing, there'll be casualties. All the leftover rods will become eyeball removers."
You: "By the way, is there a trick to fishing?"
Chibi-Bana: "A trick? Sure, but you gotta feel it! It's all about getting used to it! And having fun! In the beginning, just catching anything is a thrill! Seriously!"
Chibi-Bana: "If you want a proper answer... it depends on what you're targeting. 'Tricks' are about choosing the right gear, tools, hooks, timing—it's the sum of all those elements."
Chibi: "They say 'match the bait.' For filefish, for example, use small hooks, size 3–5. Their mouths are tiny. And after spawning in autumn is the best time—filefish get super hungry then."
Chibi: "But at first, just enjoy the ocean. Catch whatever you can! Every fish is a good fish!"
You: "Got it! I’ll just try to have fun!"
Chibi-Bana: "Yes, exactly! That's the spirit!"
You: "So, what are you aiming for, Chibi?"
Chibi-Bana: "Hmm, maybe sea bass for me. It's the season."
Chibi: "Fishing is really hard to explain, but as you do it, you'll get why the tug is so fun."
"The 'tug' is that moment when the fish grabs the bait on the hook."
Chibi: "If it's too easy, it's not that interesting. It's the stubborn fish, like sea bass, that are fun to catch."
You: "Oh, I see."
Chibi-Bana: "It's like pachinko. It's more exciting when the wait is longer after you stick in the GARO sword, right?"
This one's definitely an old guy inside!
Chibi-Bana: "Excuse me?! Who are you calling an old man!"
You: "Why do you always know what I'm thinking?!"
Chibi-Bana: "Come on, let's go shopping already."
Chibi: "We're all set now."
You: "Don’t you need to buy anything else, Chibi?"
Chibi: "Nope! Got everything I need. We're going fishing first thing tomorrow! It's a medium tide—should be good fishing!"
You: "What’s a medium tide?"
Chibi: "You know, the water level changes with the moon, right? There are these gradations, and the tides change too."
Chibi: "Basically, too rough is no good, too calm is no good either. You want the tide moving just right."
Chibi: "Small fish chase plankton, and big fish chase small fish. It's a whole food chain. If the little ones aren't moving, the big ones won't either. That's just how it is."
You: "I see..."
Chibi: "That's what we call activity levels."
Chibi: "We never notice, since we can eat whenever, but if we were in the wild, the predators would target prey when they're active. It's easier to see, too."
You: "Makes sense."
Chibi: "That's why tomorrow is a great chance! We're heading out first thing in the morning!"
You: "What time are we waking up?"
Chibi: "According to the Tide Vision, the best time to fish is around 5 a.m.!"
You: "What's that?"
Chibi: "It shows you the tide levels. Seriously, thank you so much to the people who made that site..."
You: "It's super easy to read!"
Chibi: "Right? The UI/UX is perfect!"
Chibi: "By the way, this image was generated with DALL·E. It's 1.6 MB."
You: "How big is that?"
Chibi: "This image: 1.6MB ≈ 1,600KB. Dragon Quest I (Famicom): about 40KB."
You: "What the heck? Is that efficient or not?"
Chibi: "So, it's 40 times bigger. This one image is 40 times the size of DQ1. What a masterpiece!"
You: "Even after beating the Dragonlord, that's all you get... 40/1, huh... I wish you got more friends! Feels kinda late now, though..."
You: "So, the peak is at 5 a.m.? When do we wake up?"
Chibi: "3 a.m.!"
You: "No way! That's way too early! Are you kidding me?!"
Chibi: "Have I ever lied to you? I'll kick your butt if you don't wake up!"
You: "...Another trial. Alright, I'll accept my fate!"
Chibi: "What’s with you? You're acting weird. Usually, you’d be like, 'No fair! Waaah! Mom! Tachibana!'"
You: "I do NOT say that!"
Chibi: "Anyway, get up early tomorrow. If you don't, I'm going for the gold. I'll end your family line!"
You: "Alright, alright..."
My balls are being held hostage...
